body:
Hey avicus,
since my return to minecraft in general, I have realized that on this server, there has been a pretty good increase in skill. Not only in rushing, but in PvP. I was just wondering, what you guys think separates good players from great, is it just skill, their set up, exc. Just would like to know what you guys do to be good.

-Tadhgfrancis
body_tagged:
Hey avicus,
since my return to minecraft in general, I have realized that on this server, there has been a pretty good increase in skill. Not only in rushing, but in PvP. I was just wondering, what you guys think separates good players from great, is it just skill, their set up, exc. Just would like to know what you guys do to be good.

-Tadhgfrancis
title: What separates Good PvPers from Great Pvpers

replies.body: Having good accuracy, Intelligence in tactics/ways to fight (Straight lining, Reduced - No KB). Having a decent PC with good frames can help in my opinion, as in it's easier to play with.
replies.body_tagged: Having good accuracy, Intelligence in tactics/ways to fight (Straight lining, Reduced - No KB). Having a decent PC with good frames can help in my opinion, as in it's easier to play with.

replies.body:
How many strafing tactics, bridging styles, 8 blocking, jitterclicking, etc.

I personally aint that good with the bridging part, but imo whats makes me great instead of good is how many styles of strafing I have, and how I play. Im not mr perfect, but I have pretty decent cps and I can PvP like a god. What I recommend you do to get better is just play on Kohi. That increases your skill a lot.

replies.body: just blockhit =P. 8 blocking is where you hit people for 8 blocks away. I myself have a DeathAdder, and I set the front extra button to slot 3 and the other one slot 8. I recommend you use higher FOV (your choice) and sensitivity. I use about 3200 DPI and 115 sensitivity.

replies.body: I like higher FOV, makes me feel like Im going faster. Anyways, Im trying to lower a little at a time. I just went from qp to 105. and I lower my FOV for POT (speed 2) from qp to 95, and now 105 to 90. I like to use high sensitivity since my hand doesent go that fast, so I need it. I dont jitter anyways, but if I ever get a mouse where I can get 3200 DPI and then lower to 500 for jitterclicking I ill. But right now I have a deathadder.
replies.body_tagged: I like higher FOV, makes me feel like Im going faster. Anyways, Im trying to lower a little at a time. replies.body:
hoew 2 pvp 5 r3al!!!

step1; set fov to 30
step2( click 2 times a minute and time them exactly when they are away from you
step3/ set 10000 DPI with hyperspeed sensitivity
step4: get satisfying's client
step5@ never ever strafe. It lowers ur chances of getting your aim lost. Straight line, block hit. 
step6: get stimpy internet
step7 left click 



demolish




gg
